description.plain:
Alabama Shakes is a rock band, known for their soulful, mid-20th century rhythm and blues sounding music.

The band consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Brittany Howard, bassist Zac Cockrell, backing vocalist and rhythm guitarist Heath Fogg, and and backing vocalist and drummer Steve Johnson.

Formed in 2009, they have since released two albums, Boys & Girls and Sound & Color, as well as several singles, such as “Always Alright” and “Hold On”.

Along the way, they have been nominated for seven grammy awards, winning three – Best Rock Performance and Best Rock Song for “Don’t Wanna Fight” and Best Alternative Music Album for Sound & Color.

See the whole MTV bio and how the band was formed here.

Alabama Shakes is a rock band, known for their soulful, mid-20th century rhythm and blues sounding music.

The band consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Brittany Howard, bassist Zac Cockrell, backing vocalist and rhythm guitarist Heath Fogg, and and backing vocalist and drummer Steve Johnson.

Formed in 2009, they have since released two albums, Boys & Girls and Sound & Color, as well as several singles, such as “Always Alright” and “Hold On”.

Along the way, they have been nominated for seven grammy awards, winning three – Best Rock Performance and Best Rock Song for “Don’t Wanna Fight” and Best Alternative Music Album for Sound & Color.

See the whole MTV bio and how the band was formed here.

songs.title: Sound & Color

description.plain:
“Sound & Color,” the title track from the Shakes' sophomore album, shares more than an ampersand with the band’s debut Boys & Girls, which marked the Athens, Alabama group with a “retro-soul” label and launched a sparkling tour that included a stop to play “Memphis hits” for the Obamas at The White House.

“Much of the new album lives in the same vintage thrift store as the band’s debut,” says NPR’s Tom Moon, but “Sound & Color” also marks a new plateau of success for the band, as “this time around, the musicians of Alabama Shakes match [lead singer] Brittany Howard’s intensity and actually push things higher.” This track kicks off the record with a wholly positive declaration of life’s wonders and myriad sensations.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=faG8RiaANek

songs.title: This Feeling

description.plain:
Belonging to their 2015 album “Sound & Color”, this fully emotive song acknowledges the long way the band has had to transit.

“It was kind of like having time to take a deep breath and look around and see what changes and how good it feels” says Brittany Howard, lead vocalist of the band.

In 2017, the song “This Feeling” was used in the first season of the HBO miniseries Big Little Lies, and in 2019, it was used in the end scene of the final episode of the British TV show Fleabag.

The melodic subtlety, the perfect execution of the voice and the simplicity with which they deliver this beautiful piece will make you immerse yourself in a space of internal calm from which you will emerge feeling renewed.

songs.embed_content: Read “This Feeling” by Alabama Shakes on Genius

songs.title: Hold On

description.plain:
The debut single from the Alabama Shakes, hailing from you guessed it, Athens, Alabama. “Hold On” was symbolic of the phenomenon that the band became in 2012, as the song was well received all over the world.

The band’s rise to fame took them by surprise. In and interview with Pharell, Brittany Howard (front woman) describes how the band rose together to meet the demands of the opportunities presented to them.

Humble beginnings led to the group’s humble expectations for the future. Leaving Athens, Alabama to tour the world was not on their radar. However, a deep commitment to the creative process and their fans inspired them to travel down new paths.

songs.embed_content: Read “Hold On” by Alabama Shakes on Genius

The band’s rise to fame took them by surprise. In and interview with Pharell, Brittany Howard (front woman) describes how the band rose together to meet the demands of the opportunities presented to them.

Humble beginnings led to the group’s humble expectations for the future. Leaving Athens, Alabama to tour the world was not on their radar. However, a deep commitment to the creative process and their fans inspired them to travel down new paths.
